questions.text: What is the name of the Steadmans' dog?
questions.explanation:
Grendel.

	Named for the monster in 'Beowulf,' an epic that gets mentioned several times during the series.

questions.text: To whom did Hope lose her virginity?
questions.explanation:
Danny Garvey.

	Revealed early on, and mentioned in the fourth season episode 'Happy New Year.'

questions.text: While trying to decide what last name to give their daughter, Gary and Susannah half-jokingly resort to picking names at random from the phone book. Had they gone through with this method, what would her name be?
questions.explanation:
Emma Wu.

	They settled on 'Emma Hart-Shepherd.'

questions.text: When Melissa was in high school, she had a crush on a particular boy, and wanted to 'pick the leaves off his fuzzy sweater.' What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Duffy Swift.

	Ellyn's response to Melissa's description of Duffy: 'God, I don't even know him, and *I* want to do that.'

questions.text: Miles Drentell: 'Revenge is a decidedly _________________ pursuit.'
questions.explanation:
middle-class & middle class.

	Without a doubt, my favorite character from the series.

questions.text: What do Elliot and Deb (Nancy's sister) call each other?
questions.explanation:
Jules.

	The reason that they call each other 'Jules' was never explained, oddly enough.

questions.text: Michael gives special significance to one particular film that he went to see in college with his 'soulmate' Emily Birch. What film was it?
questions.explanation:
'Carnal Knowledge'.

	Emily was played by the alluring Chelsea Field, who is married to 'Quantum Leap' and 'Enterprise' star Scott Bakula.

questions.text: What is the name of the support group that Nancy attends after her second round of chemotherapy?
questions.explanation:
Victory Partners.

	Elliot eventually started accompanying Nancy to Victory Partners meetings.

questions.text: Ellyn Warren: 'Why does female bonding always involve ____________________?'
questions.explanation:
vanilla extract.

	Had I been in the room, I would have responded with, 'It doesn't.'

questions.text: When Michael and Elliot started working for DAA, they were assigned a car campaign -- the Spingieri Stazzi. What was Michael's idea for the commercial's tagline?
questions.explanation:
'Go. And stop.'

	Elliot loved the idea, but it turned out to be too similar to a campaign DAA had recently done for another automotive client.
